Class OPL

  • java.lang.Object
    • Election
      • OPL
  • public class OPL
extends Election
    The OPL class is in charge of running an Open Party List election and outputting any results to the audit file, media report, and display.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Election

        auditString, totalNumBallots

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      OPL​(int totalNumBallots, int numSeatsAvailable, java.util.ArrayList<Party> parties)
      The constructor for OPL initializes the OPL class so it is ready to run the OPL algorithm.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected void generateAuditFile()
      Creates the audit file and outputs the auditString to the new file.
      protected void generateMediaFile()
      Creates the media file and outputs the election results, seat allocation statistics, votes for each candidate, and additionalNotes to the new file.
      java.util.HashMap<Party,​java.lang.Integer> getFirstAllocation()
      Gets the mapping of the parties to their first allocation of seats.
      int getNumSeatsAvailable()
      Gets the number of seats that are in the election.

      Gets the quota for the election.

      Gets the number of ballots cast in the election.

      Gets the candidates who won a seat in the election.
      protected void outputResults()

      Main function to run voting algorithm for OPL.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OPL

        public OPL​(int totalNumBallots,
           int numSeatsAvailable,
           java.util.ArrayList<Party> parties)
    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The constructor for OPL initializes the OPL class so it is ready to run the OPL algorithm. It is assumed that the parties have been initialized with the candidates for the election, and that the totalNumBallots and numSeatsAvailable are positive.
        Parameters:
        totalNumBallots - the total number of ballots cast for this election.
        numSeatsAvailable - the number of seats that are up for election.
        parties - a list of parties that have candidates in the election.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the totalNumBallots or numSeatsAvailable is nonpositive, or the parties is null or empty.

    • Method Detail

      • runVotingAlgorithm

        public void runVotingAlgorithm()
        Main function to run voting algorithm for OPL. This will conduct the first allocation, second allocation, determine the winners, output the audit file, output the media report, and output the election results to the screen.
        Specified by:
        runVotingAlgorithm in class Election

      • getQuota

        public int getQuota()
        Gets the quota for the election.

      • getFirstAllocation

        public java.util.HashMap<Party,​java.lang.Integer> getFirstAllocation()
        Gets the mapping of the parties to their first allocation of seats.
        Returns:
        a mapping from Parties to the number of seats they won in the first allocation.
